DataElement.preferredName: Therapy Related Malignant Neoplasm Myelodysplastic Syndrome And/Or Chronic Myeloproliferative Disorder Etiology Occurrence Yes No Character Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a therapy related malignant neoplasm myelodysplastic syndrome and/or chronic myeloproliferative disorder etiology occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapy Related Malignant Neoplasm Myelodysplastic Syndrome And/Or Chronic Myeloproliferative Disorder Etiology Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The development of a malignant neoplasm in response to medical or surgical treatment, induced by the treatment itself._A clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines. The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia.  It may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy.(WHO, 2001)._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Chronic myeloproliferative disorders (CMPDs) are clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorders, characterized by proliferation in the bone marrow of one or more of the myeloid (i.e., granulocytic, erythroid, and megakaryocytic) lineages.  The proliferation is associated with relatively normal, effective maturation, resulting in increased numbers of granulocytes, red blood cells, and/or platelets in the peripheral blood.  CMPDs are primarily diseases of adults._The cause of a disease._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Therapy Related Malignant Neoplasm MDS And/Or Chronic Myeloproliferative Disorder Etiology
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The development of a malignant neoplasm in response to medical or surgical treatment, induced by the treatment itself.:Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) is a clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines.  The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia.  MDS may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:Chronic myeloproliferative disorders (CMPDs) are clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorders, characterized by proliferation in the bone marrow of one or more of the myeloid (i.e., granulocytic, erythroid, and megakaryocytic) lineages.  The proliferation is associated with relatively normal, effective maturation, resulting in increased numbers of granulocytes, red blood cells, and/or platelets in the peripheral blood.  CMPDs are primarily diseases of adults.  -- 2003:The cause of a disease.

Concepts.definition: The development of a malignant neoplasm in response to medical or surgical treatment, induced by the treatment itself.

A clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines. The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia. It may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy. (WHO, 2001)
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

A group of myeloid neoplasms that includes the following: chronic myeloid leukemia, BCR-ABL1 positive; polycythemia vera; essential thrombocythemia;  primary myelofibrosis; chronic neutrophilic leukemia; chronic eosinophilic leukemia, not otherwise specified; and myeloproliferative neoplasm, unclassifiable.
The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
